member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether low values should be prioritized. Normally high values from the field are given a higher priority. If this is true, low values are given priority instead.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Symbology.ILabelSymbolizer.PriorityField
member.summary: Gets or sets the string field name for the field that controls which labels get placed first. If collision detection is on, a higher priority means will get placed first. If it is off, higher priority will be labeled on top of lower priority.

member.summary: Calculates a random floating point value that ranges between (inclusive) the specified minimum and maximum values.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The other bound of the range

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Symbology.Range.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class where both the minimum and maximum are the same value and both are inclusive.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Symbology.Range.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A string expression that can be two separate numbers separated by a dash

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Symbology.Range.Maximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value. If this is null, the upper range is unbounded.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Symbology.Range.MaxIsInclusive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the upper bounds includes the maximum value.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Symbology.Range.Minimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the Minimum value. If this is null, the lower range is unbounded.

member.name: P:EM.GIS.Symbology.Range.MinIsInclusive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the lower bounds includes the minimum value.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Symbology.Range.Contains(System.Double)
member.summary: Tests to determine if this range contains the specified double value.
member.returns: Boolean, true if the value is within the current bounds.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Symbology.Range.ToExpression(System.String)
member.summary: Generates a valid SQL query expression for this range, using the field string as the member being compared. The field string should already be bound in brackets, or put together as a normal composit like "[males]/[pop1990]"
member.param: The field name to build into an expression. This should already be wrapped in square brackets.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Symbology.Range.ToString
member.summary: Expresses this range in string form. By default, ranges include the maximum, and exclude the minimum. A null value for one expression will result in a a semi-unbounded range using the greater than or less than symbols. A null expression for both values is completely unbounded and will result in a string that reads like [All Values].

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Symbology.Range.ToString(EM.GIS.Symbology.IntervalSnapMethod,System.Int32)
member.summary: This is a slightly more complex specification where the numeric formatting controls how the generated string will appear.
member.param: This is only used for rounding or significant figures, but controls those options
member.returns: A string equivalent of this range, but using a number format.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Symbology.Range.FixOrder
member.summary: If the minimum and maximum are out of order, this reverses them.

member.summary: The selection mode that can be used when selecting things.

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Symbology.SelectionMode.Contains
member.summary: The vertices of the feature are all inside (and not touching the boundary of) the region.

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Symbology.SelectionMode.ContainsExtent
member.summary: *Faster, the item to be selected must be completely contained by the extent

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Symbology.SelectionMode.CoveredBy
member.summary: The entire region is inside the feature and not touching the border.

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Symbology.SelectionMode.Covers
member.summary: The feature is completely inside the region, but touching the edges is ok (unlike Contains).

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Symbology.SelectionMode.Crosses
member.summary: For this to be true the feature must be a point or a curve and must cross the specified

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Symbology.SelectionMode.Disjoint
member.summary: The interiors and boundaries don't intersect, touch, or overlap, so they are completely separate.

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Symbology.SelectionMode.IntersectsExtent
member.summary: *Faster, the item will be selected if any part of that item is visible in the extent

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Symbology.SelectionMode.Intersects
member.summary: The most inclusive possible. If any element is touching or overlapping the region in any way, then this will be true.

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Symbology.SelectionMode.Overlaps
member.summary: Like intersects, specifically requires that part of the feature is inside and part of the feature is outside of the region.

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Symbology.SelectionMode.Touches
member.summary: The feature has borders or edges in common, but otherwise does not fall inside the region.

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Symbology.SelectionMode.Within
member.summary: The region is found completely inside the specified region to the extent that no borders come in contact with the outside edge of the region.

member.name: T:EM.GIS.Symbology.SymbologyGlobal
member.summary: Global has some basic methods that may be useful in lots of places.

member.name: F:EM.GIS.Symbology.SymbologyGlobal.DefaultRandom
member.summary: An instance of Random that is created when needed and sits around so we don't keep creating new ones.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Symbology.SymbologyGlobal.ColorFromHsl(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a colour from HSL to RGB.
member.remarks: Adapted from the algoritm in Foley and Van-Dam
member.param: A double representing degrees ranging from 0 to 360 and is equal to the GetHue() on a Color structure.
A double value ranging from 0 to 1, where 0 is gray and 1 is fully saturated with color.
A double value ranging from 0 to 1, where 0 is black and 1 is white.
member.returns: A Color structure with the equivalent hue saturation and brightness

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Symbology.SymbologyGlobal.DrawRoundedRectangle(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Pen,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Draws a rectangle with ever so slightly rounded edges. Good for selection borders.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Symbology.SymbologyGlobal.GetRectangle(System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Obtains a system.Drawing.Rectangle based on the two points, using them as opposite extremes for the rectangle.
member.param: one corner point of the rectangle.
The opposing corner of the rectangle.

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Symbology.SymbologyGlobal.HighlightBrush(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Gets a cool Highlight brush for highlighting things.
member.param: The color to use for the higlight

member.name: M:EM.GIS.Symbology.SymbologyGlobal.RandomColor
member.summary: Returns a completely random opaque color.
